content.raw: I think making collisions optional is ok for now. I still need to look into what exactly caused the collapsed models… :flushed: I’ll keep you updated. Also, thanks for forward-porting branches to citadel!
content.html: I think making collisions optional is ok for now. I still need to look into what exactly caused the collapsed models… I’ll keep you updated. Also, thanks for forward-porting branches to citadel!

content.raw: Ohh I totally made collisions optional because I saw TPE didn't have the feature :sweat_smile: Thanks for investigating.
content.html: Ohh I totally made collisions optional because I saw TPE didn't have the feature Thanks for investigating.

content.raw:
I got the same thing with warning 

```
[Wrn] [Physics.cc:789] Can't process Collision entity, physics engine missing ConstructSdfCollision feature
```

I suspect there is a problem with `ConstructSdfCollision` and `EntityManagement`. The former doesn’t seem to be registered on the `FeatureList` while the latter has unit test failures. I’ll investigate and push changes to [pull request #129](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/129/wip-citadel-tpe-plugin). 

`/lib` should be good to merge since it’s only establishing `Entity` structures not handling `Features`.
content.html:
I got the same thing with warning 

[Wrn] [Physics.cc:789] Can't process Collision entity, physics engine missing ConstructSdfCollision feature

I suspect there is a problem with ConstructSdfCollision and EntityManagement. The former doesn’t seem to be registered on the FeatureList while the latter has unit test failures. I’ll investigate and push changes to pull request #129.

/lib should be good to merge since it’s only establishing Entity structures not handling Features.

content.raw:
The `chapulina/tpe` (citadel) branch on `ign-gazebo` is able to load TPE. I haven't looked closely at the TPE code yet, but loading `shapes.sdf` with that branch collapses all 3 shapes to the origin. I don't know if the issue is here or on pull request #129 or on `ign-gazebo`, but I think the shapes should stay in place.

`ign gazebo -v 2 -r shapes.sdf --physics-engine ignition-physics-tpe-plugin`
content.html:
The chapulina/tpe (citadel) branch on ign-gazebo is able to load TPE. I haven't looked closely at the TPE code yet, but loading shapes.sdf with that branch collapses all 3 shapes to the origin. I don't know if the issue is here or on pull request #129 or on ign-gazebo, but I think the shapes should stay in place.

ign gazebo -v 2 -r shapes.sdf --physics-engine ignition-physics-tpe-plugin

content.raw: I think so.
content.html: I think so.

content.raw: @{557058:5de38267-b118-494c-aa76-4fab35448816} I’ll update the code and add test  casefor it. Thanks for coming up with an equation! would’ve taken me a while to figure out :sweat_smile:
content.html: @Steve Peters I’ll update the code and add test casefor it. Thanks for coming up with an equation! would’ve taken me a while to figure out

content.raw: we could add a unit test for UpdatePose I suppose
content.html: we could add a unit test for UpdatePose I suppose

I think this might do it:

diff -r 42fc3f4f2835 tpe/lib/src/Model.cc
--- a/tpe/lib/src/Model.cc      Fri Apr 03 00:10:14 2020 -0700
+++ b/tpe/lib/src/Model.cc      Fri Apr 03 10:48:06 2020 -0700
@@ -77,9 +77,8 @@
   const math::Vector3d _angularVelocity)
 {
   math::Pose3d currentPose = this->GetPose();
-  math::Pose3d changeInPose;
-  changeInPose.Set(
-    _linearVelocity * _timeStep, _angularVelocity * _timeStep);
-  math::Pose3d nextPose = currentPose + changeInPose;
+  math::Pose3d nextPose(
+      currentPose.Pos() + _linearVelocity * _timeStep,
+      currentPose.Rot().Integrate(_angularVelocity, _timeStep));
   this->SetPose(nextPose);
 }

content.raw: I assume the velocity vectors are all in the world frame?
content.html: I assume the velocity vectors are all in the world frame?

content.raw:
oh, good catch, I think this can be improved

as it happens, we think there's a bug in dart's FreeJoint implementation: https://github.com/dartsim/dart/pull/1437

I would recommend using the [ignition::math::Quaternion::Integrate](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/src/967f3fd478ef2993e4b5fce7204cefc0b2d24a86/include/ignition/math/Quaternion.hh#lines-915:945) function
content.html:
oh, good catch, I think this can be improved

as it happens, we think there's a bug in dart's FreeJoint implementation: https://github.com/dartsim/dart/pull/1437

I would recommend using the ignition::math::Quaternion::Integrate function

content.raw: See [https://github.com/dartsim/dart/blob/v6.9.2/dart/dynamics/FreeJoint.cpp#L587](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/blob/v6.9.2/dart/dynamics/FreeJoint.cpp#L587) for a similar piece of code in DART codebase.
content.html: See https://github.com/dartsim/dart/blob/v6.9.2/dart/dynamics/FreeJoint.cpp#L587 for a similar piece of code in DART codebase.

content.raw: I may be missing something, but this should not be nextPose = currentPose\*changeInPose ?
content.html: I may be missing something, but this should not be nextPose = currentPose*changeInPose ?

content.raw: As far as I understand the second argument of the `changeInPose` should  be the euler angle representation of the rotation matrix poseOld\_R\_poseNew  \(while currentPose is world\_R\_poseOld and nextPose is world\_R\_poseNext\) . In that case, unless I am missing something, the derivative of the euler  angles are not equal to the angular velocity multiplied by a timestep?
content.html: As far as I understand the second argument of the changeInPose should be the euler angle representation of the rotation matrix poseOld_R_poseNew (while currentPose is world_R_poseOld and nextPose is world_R_poseNext) . In that case, unless I am missing something, the derivative of the euler angles are not equal to the angular velocity multiplied by a timestep?

nice work!
content.html:

content.html: if this has a move constructor, it should have a move assignment operator as well (rule of 5)

content.raw: looks good to me, thanks for iterating and fixing the warnings!
content.html: looks good to me, thanks for iterating and fixing the warnings!

content.raw: I got that number by searching the warning message online so not sure how accurate the corresponding level would be, but yeah I’d love to revert back the function as long as it doesn’t break CI again.
content.html: I got that number by searching the warning message online so not sure how accurate the corresponding level would be, but yeah I’d love to revert back the function as long as it doesn’t break CI again.

content.raw: Thanks! Interesting, that's a level 1 warning. SDFormat is configured with warn level [W4](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/src/f5d8f83eaec2d320bf3bda06ee8f2893ada2c6c2/CMakeLists.txt#lines-186), and I think `ign-physics` is using `ign-cmake`'s [W2](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/src/126d3fd87e884fc6b87e4b35e4bc1453f414ef12/cmake/IgnSetCompilerFlags.cmake#lines-288). I didn't find any place where SDF suppresses it, but I could be missing something.
content.html: Thanks! Interesting, that's a level 1 warning. SDFormat is configured with warn level W4, and I think ign-physics is using ign-cmake's W2. I didn't find any place where SDF suppresses it, but I could be missing something.

content.raw: @{557058:6ff86fcb-b7ab-44a5-b8a6-f6d9cae8b6e8} I think the warning number is C4717: 'function' : recursive on all control paths, function will cause runtime stack overflow
content.html: @Louise Poubel I think the warning number is C4717: 'function' : recursive on all control paths, function will cause runtime stack overflow

content.raw: Interesting, we've been using that pattern on [SDF](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/src/f5d8f83eaec2d320bf3bda06ee8f2893ada2c6c2/src/AirPressure.cc#lines-65) and Windows has no warnings. It's possible that we're just suppressing the warning. I see you mentioned "windows recursive warning" [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/commits/58f53277534dccadd325a70b14ec0ef5f9553ba8) but all Jenkins builds before that are gone, so I can't check the exact warning number.
content.html: Interesting, we've been using that pattern on SDF and Windows has no warnings. It's possible that we're just suppressing the warning. I see you mentioned "windows recursive warning" here but all Jenkins builds before that are gone, so I can't check the exact warning number.

content.raw: We originally used `return *this = Collision(_other)` but that causes windows CI warning, so the current one is a workaround.
content.html: We originally used return *this = Collision(_other) but that causes windows CI warning, so the current one is a workaround.

content.raw: Do you want to print a warning here so the user knows the `SetShape` call failed?
content.html: Do you want to print a warning here so the user knows the SetShape call failed?

Instead of copying each member here, I think you should be able to do:

Collision::Collision(const Collision &_other)
  : Entity(), dataPtr(new CollisionPrivate(*_other.dataPtr))
{
}

Then whenever a new member is added to CollisionPrivate, we don't need to worry about adding a line here because it will be automatically copied.

For the copy assignment operator below, you could do:

Collision &Collision::operator=(const Collision &_other)
{
  return *this = Collision(_other);
}

The same goes for other classes implementing their own copy constructor / operators, like Entity.

content.raw:
should `${tpe-plugin}` be just `tpe-plugin`? i.e `${CMAKE_SHARED_LIBRARY_PREFIX}${PROJECT_NAME_NO_VERSION_LOWER}-tpe-plugin${CMAKE_SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIX}`

looking at dartsim-plugin’s [CMakeLists.txt](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/src/4b4831e05a1a1288ae166e90414e1355834883fa/dartsim/CMakeLists.txt#lines-43), it’s using the variable `engine_name` to store the string `dartsim_plugin` but in our case we’re are just using the string directly
content.html:
should ${tpe-plugin} be just tpe-plugin? i.e ${CMAKE_SHARED_LIBRARY_PREFIX}${PROJECT_NAME_NO_VERSION_LOWER}-tpe-plugin${CMAKE_SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIX}

looking at dartsim-plugin’s CMakeLists.txt, it’s using the variable engine_name to store the string dartsim_plugin but in our case we’re are just using the string directly
